alert.note: Alert for San Luis Obispo County Beaches; Santa Barbara County Central Coast Beaches (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued December 25 at 2:21AM PST until December 26 at 3:00PM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM PST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Large breaking waves of 9 to 12 feet, with local sets to 13 feet and dangerous rip currents. Surf peaking on Monday. Abnormally high tides each morning around 7.0 feet are expected. * WHERE...San Luis Obispo County Beaches and Santa Barbara County Central Coast Beaches. * WHEN...Until 3 PM PST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...There is an increased risk for ocean drowning. Rip currents can pull swimmers and surfers out to sea. Large breaking waves can cause injury, wash people off beaches and rocks, and capsize small boats near shore. Pooling of sea water is possible around high tide at beach and harbor areas that is uncommon with normal tidal ranges. Enhanced beach erosion is also possible. No significant damage is expected. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...High tides will occur each morning between 700 AM and 830 AM. Surf will build rapidly this morning up to 13 feet. Later on, very large surf is expected late Wednesday night through at least Saturday. During this time, there is the potential for warning level surf of 20 feet. This very large surf combined with relatively high tides of 6.0 to 6.5 feet, may result in more significant coastal flooding and beach erosion. This could require the issuance of a coastal flood advisory as we draw closer to the event.
info.instruction: Remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions, or stay near occupied lifeguard towers. Rock jetties can be deadly locations in such conditions, so stay off the rocks.

area.areaDesc: San Luis Obispo County Beaches; Santa Barbara County Central Coast Beaches
